answer: It indicates that the pilot should fly a **right pattern** when landing on runway 22. If you look immediately west of the airport on the sectional chart you will see the likely reason for the non-standard pattern. Their is rising terrain due to a ridge line immediately west and flying a normal (left hand) pattern for 22 may put pilots too close to the terrain. This is only one of the many reasons a right pattern would be indicated. Others might be to avoid noise sensitive areas, or other obstructions.
